title: Alice Cooper: ‘I blew all my cash on coke. Luckily, my manager had hidden $2m'
text:
Alice Cooper, 71, the singer, songwriter and actor, first found fame in 1972 when School’s Out reached No 1 in Britain.

Numerous hit singles and albums followed and Alice Cooper, first as a band and then as a solo act, has sold more than 50 million records. Today he lives in Arizona with his wife, Sheryl.

How did your childhood influence your attitude to money?

We were a middle-class family from Detroit, which was very industrial. My dad was an honest used car salesman, not good at getting money at all. So getting your allowance on Saturdays was a big deal. You really did carefully plan out where that 50 cents would go.

Later, when I started making a lot of money, money became stressful, so I...
description: Alice Cooper, 71, the singer, songwriter and actor, first found fame in 1972 when School’s Out reached No 1 in Britain.
